column1: lobbed up outside off and he drills this drive along the floor, straight to long-off
full at off stump, looks to jab this through cover, gets an inside edge into the leg side
full and pushed through flat at off stump. Another feeble push from Watson, thick inside edge into the midwicket region
length outside off, firmly punched off the back foot to long-off
length ball fired down leg side, gets on top of this whips the sweep past short fine with a forward stride
length at off stump, blocked on the front foot
shot. Length ball curving into the hips. He gets on his toes and uses the angle to flick neatly behind square leg

dropped! Buttler has been put down at first slip. Dwarshius hits the same length - just short of a good length - but he takes it across off stump this line. Buttler jabs at it, no feet, possibly for the one that swings in. It carries cleanly but he fluffs this at shin height
short ball just outside off, walks down at it and gets an inside edge onto body as he looks to play the pull
short of a length just outside off, hurriedly punched into the off side off the back foot
short of a length just outside off, gently pushed towards mid-off off the back foot. Soft hands and they steal the single
short of a length on leg stump, defended into the pitch with a closed face
length ball at leg stump, offers the full face and jabs this past the non-striker
length ball at middle stump, a bit of wobble towards off. defended solidly down the pitch off the front foot
length and just outside off, defended into the covers

pick-up shot clears mid-on comfortably and then just climbs over the boundary. Clean from Watson. Length ball at leg stump, leans in just a touch but allows enough room for the elevation. Offers the full face and just lofts it in the end
whack. Short ball outside off, gets on the front foot and slaps it through midwicket
length ball just outside off, punched to extra cover off the back foot

that's a poor ball. Dropped short outside off, seems like a slower ball. At the very least, it rose off slowly from the surface. That meant plenty of time for Buttler to pull aerially in front of square
beats him with the slower ball. The back-of-the-hand slower ball, dips under Buttler's slog just outside off. Looked a nice full toss, but he deceived him
thick inside edge and there's no one at fine leg. Full ball slanted into the legs. Looks to cream this over mid-off, but he hasn't made great connection on it. It all works out
full on middle stump, driven to mid-on's left
length at off stump, defended off the back foot
length ball straightens in the corridor as he looks to defend on the front foot. That was angled in and jagged away
short of a length at off stump, looks for the pull and gets under it a bit too much. Lifted over midwicket. A shovel more than anything by the end
nicely done. This is overpitched outside off and he chops the bat down on this and carves it between cover and extra cover
full and just outside off, sliced uppishly, straight to cover
slower ball at a length, wide outside off. Picks it, waits on it, lets it rise, and then slaps it past backward point
dropped short at a leg stump line, Buttler barely has anything to do in terms of feet. Swivels the upper body, gets the bat down on it and caresses it past short fine
full on leg stump, flicked along the floor to deep midwicket
length ball on leg stump, flicked to deep square
low full toss into the pads, stands tall and whips to deep backward square
short of a length slower ball outside off, toe-ended drive off the front foot, into the covers

beats the infield and that's all's needed. Even with the poor connection. Short of a length on leg stump. Swipes at it, gets it off the inside half and short fine's attempt to his left is not convincing. Tumbles and lets it through
smashes leg stump! Length ball doesn't quite rise enough for Watson, who has had a big slog at this.The stump is out of the ground, and so is Watson
length ball outside off, tapped into the covers on the up
length ball in at off stump, defended into the off side on the up
full ball slanted in at middle stump, leans in to try and poke into the covers. Gets it down the pitch off the inside edge
short of a length just outside off, gets on the back foot and punches firmly back at the bowler. Just drops short of him
length ball in at leg stump, tickled to short fine's left off the back foot
length on leg stump, defended on the front foot
length at leg stump, whipped to deep midwicket off the back foot
short ball outside off, gets deep in the crease and pulls to long-on's right
length ball skidding through in the corridor. Stabs at it and gets an inside edge into the leg side
full on middle stump, gets to the pitch and pumps it straight and flat over the non-striker
short ball at leg stump, nicely on top of this and a clean swing to pull this between deep square and deep midwicket
short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper cover
dropped short at middle stump, gets back deep in the crease and pummels this! High over deep midwicket. Pope just not able to get one full at the moment
short of a length at off stump, sliding into him. Backs away and punches to extra cover
length and in at middle stump, chops it into the turf as he looks to cut
length at leg stump, driven to long-on off the front foot
length ball wide outside off, reaches out and drags it off the toe to long-on
length ball outside off, skids low and past the attempted drive through the off side. Beats keeper too
length outside off, driven to extra cover on the up
length ball pushed down leg side, past the attempted flick
short ball at middle stump, pulled to deep midwicket

clears long-on! And that is fifty. Nothing quite like a Buttler straight six. Such a stylish swing from under the ball. This one's landed full on a leg stump line and his half-stride gets him to the pitch
full on leg stump, flicked to long-on
short of a length on leg stump, tapped to long-on off the back foot
full on leg stump, looks to flick and cops it on the pad
length at leg stump, punched to long-on on the up
length outside off, sliced to extra cover on the up
short of a length on leg stump, flicked off the hips and a misfield at midwicket gives them the run
low full toss on leg stump, flicked straight to deep square
slower ball, full toss dipping outside off. Flicked straight to midwicket
length ball angled in at leg stump, flicked aerially and to deep square's right
breaks the shackles against O'Keefe. Steps out at the length ball, doesn't get to the pitch, but he hits through the line and and smashes it straight over the bowler
length at leg stump, punched to long-on with the angle
short of a length on leg stump, punched off the back foot to long-on
short of a length at middle stump, drags the pull aerially between deep midwicket and long-on
finds long-on. Another dragged pull, this one is better connected and carries to the fielder. It was short of a length on middle stump and he was through the shot too early
full on leg stump, flicked to short fine
length on leg stump, flicked to deep midwicket on the up
short of a length outside off, looks to chop with a horizontal bat, beaten
short ball at off stump, pulled to deep midwicket who fumbles to his left and allows the extra run
full outside off, drags a sweep out to long-on
length at middle stump, pulled to deep midwicket's left
length at leg stump, punched between long-on and deep midwicket
length ball just outside off, flicks into the leg side off the back foot
short and wide outside off, chopped to third man

oh terrible mix-up and we're trying to figure out which batsman is out. It was a short ball across off stump, looks to cut, he's beaten. There's a slight fumble behind. Joe Root wants the run and has run through completely. Ferguson is ball-watching and outside the crease as Root makes it to the other end. The throw goes to the bowler and it is confirmed Ferguson is the one who will leave. He didn't want that run
length on leg stump, flicked to deep square
short of a length slower ball lifts off the surface and past the outside edge as he looks to punch into the covers
length ball wide outside off, walks into this drive and is beaten. Wasn't close to the pitch of that
short of a length and down leg side, swipes on the rise and gets it to the deep backward square boundary
past the inside edge and into middle stump! Length ball slides in and Root is driving for the turn. Wasn't to the pitch of that and he pays the price with a big gap for the ball to skid through
short and wide outside off, stays back and chops hard behind square on the off side. Sweeper sprints to his left and puts in a slide, but he can't save the four runs here
length ball flat and wide outside off, puts half a stride out and slaps at it. Gets it off the toe-end but he's cleared extra cover and the ball dribbles away
length at off stump, defended on the front foot
length at leg stump, flicked to midwicket's right
short ball at leg stump, stays under it and swivels to launch this high over the long leg boundary. Quick hands from Sams and he's already taken the momentum away from Sixers
and another! Not connected ideally, but it's 91 metres! Another short ball on leg stump, gets big on him a little but he heaves and clears deep square
short and wide outside off, reaches out and slices this over short third
short ball at off stump, chest height. Backs away and looks to slap wide of mid-off, but this is off the sticker
length at off stump, hurriedly defended down the pitch
length at middle stump, flicked to fine leg's left
full toss on leg stump, flicked to deep midwicket
slower ball at a length just outside off, poked into the covers off the front foot
low full toss on leg stump, can't get enough of a swing on this slog. It's off the low part of the bat and down to long-on
taken at mid-off! That's a sharp catch from Abbott. Length ball on off stump, clears the front leg and drills this with an open face. Abbot lunges to his left and takes it with a reverse-cup
length on leg stump, flicked to midwicket
another at mid-off! Full slower ball just outside off, backs away and drills it hard and this time Abbott has to time a jump. And he executes it well. Good technique again on the reverse-cup

sensational catch! Phillipe flies to his right and holds on, one-handed! The innings has flipped in three balls. Sams is gone now and this will cost runs. Dwarshius was around the wicket, bowled it short and wide outside off. Sams wanted to play the late cut and get it fine, but the keeper has held on at about one-and-a-half slip
short and wide outside off, slashes and misses
length ball at middle stump, poked to long-on off the back foot and they get an overthrow in the off side as the throw comes in from there
short of a length outside off, looks to cut, gets it into the turf off the under-edge
full ball slanted away from off stump, poked straight to point
length on leg stump, flicked delicately into the square leg region and they get two as a result as the deep fielders converge on it
length at leg stump, steps out and chips off the inside half to deep midwicket
short and wide outside off, waits on it and swats uppishly to the point boundary
short ball just outside off, looks to hook, gets it off the sticker into the off side
length ball at middle stump, clears the front leg to slog, but gets an inside edge onto that very leg. Trickles pitch side on the leg side and they steal the run
short ball outside off, gets on the front foot and pulls powerfully past the non-striker. Long-on cleans up to his left
slower ball at a length outside off, driven on the rise, just clears the bowler but can't beat mid-off
beamer climbs over off stump as he looks to hoick it into the leg side. He'll get a free hit
a wide off the free-hit ball! Decent enough delivery. Back of the hand slower ball at a length outside off. Beats him on the slog again, but this spins past the wide marker
yorker at leg stump, looks to slog at this, gets it to short third off the boot. Nicely executed from Curran
yorker outside off, looks to chop it through off side and is beaten
yorker slanting in at middle stump, steps out and jams at it. For his efforts - an inside edge past leg stump. That's racing away, no one to stop it in the deep

slower ball at a length on off stump. Steps out and swings on it. Beaten. And then Phillipe picks it up on the bounce and breaks the stumps with an underarm flick to catch McAndrew short of his crease as he tries to pinch a single
Another superbly executed yorker from Tom Curran. Batsman exposes the stumps and has a swing at it but is comprehensively beaten
full and in at the pads. Stays tall as he flicks this off the toes and past square leg
length at middle stump, steps out and flicks to midwicket
full on off stump, reaches out and picks it up over midwicket. Lands to deep midwicket's left
just clears mid-on. Wanted to slog that over the fielder, but this came off the toe-end. Length ball sliding in at off stump, was there for the hit considering his big reach
length at off stump, slogs at it again. Thick inside edge to deep square
length at off stump, defended into the covers off the front foot
length on middle stump, closes the face on that and gets a leading edge to poit
length ball wide outside off, driven on the up to extra cover

past the outside edge and into off stump! Wants to go inside-out, over mid-off. But he isn't behind the line of it and the stump is exposed as he goes for this. Late movement away off the pitch does him
length on leg stump, flicked to midwicket's right
length ball just outside off, guided to third man with an angled bat
length ball swung in late at leg stump. Can't get the flick away. It's a single at square leg
full at off stump, steps out and taps to mid-off off the toe-end
yorker length at leg stump, flicked to midwicket
length at middle stump, steps out and clips to midwicket's right
length outside off, onto the back foot to push this down the pitch
length at leg stump, steps out and yorks himself. Jams it into the midwicket region

down the pitch but given! Length ball skids through and catches him in front of middle stump as he looks to flick. That didn't rise too much, caught him under the knee with his front leg planted across the stumps. Edwards not happy about the decision, but it's closer than he thinks it is. Replays confirm that was hitting leg
length ball pushed across the stumps, looks to drive on the up and is beaten on the outside edge
short of a length on leg stump, gets big and stays tall as he nudges this past short fine. Deep square sprints a long way to cover this
length outside off, leans in and uses his wrists to caress this - uppishly. Uses the face and gets it over extra cover
length at leg stump, dropped in front of short fine with a closed face
stylish. Length ball slanted across off stump. Squats and leans into this with a horizontal bat before driving it past backward point
length outside off, expansive cover drive straight to the cover fielder
length ball pushed wide outside off, slashes and misses
length outside off, sliced to point on the up
full outside off, driven straight to extra cover off the front foot
dropped short outside off, pulled firmly, but straight to midwicket
full on off stump, opens up to try and carve through the off side. Gets it to long-on off the inside half
full on leg stump, flicked through square leg
slower ball, short of a length outside off. Guided straight ti short third
length ball in at off stump. Driven on the up to extra cover
slower ball, short of a length on off stump. Gets on the back foot and pulls to deep square

mid-on pedals backwards and holds on. Henriques deceived by the slower ball. It was lobbed up at leg stump. He wanted to loft it over mid-on, in the last over of the Powerplay. But he was early on it and could only get it high, not far
full on leg stump, flicked to midwicket
slower ball full outside off. Bunted into the off side off the toe-end
googly, short of a length just outside off. Stabbed to point off the back foot
tonks leg stump. Fawad gets a length ball to skid on. Silk is deep in the crease trying to punch and just completely misses this. His reaction suggests he thought this would bounce higher than it did
length, googly at leg stump. Flicked through square leg

outside edge past keeper's leg and through to the boundary. He was late on that, possibly because he was trying to see which way it's going off the surface. It skid straight on and took the low part of the outside edge, into the turf and away for four, as he pushed aimlessly at it
googly, at a length on off. Defended into the off side

bowled him! Once again, Hughes is frozen as this approaches him. Just no idea which way the ball is going. This comes in off a length and he's set up for the googly, on the back foot. Past the inside edge and into middle and leg stump
bouncer at leg stump, hooked down to fine leg

slower ball at a length on off stump. Dabbed to point who gets a little tangled up and loses balance as he sprints in to pick up. Can't balance himself for the throw at the non-striker's end and the batsman survives
nicely played. Full ball on leg stump, gets on top of the line and closes the face late to get this flick past midwicket
full slower ball outside off, jabs it to point again. Sangha more balanced as he puts in the throw this time, but he doesn't hit the stumps and Phillipe seemed to have made it
short ball across the corridor, looks to hook and is beaten
slower ball dropped short and very wide outside off. Chops from under it and gets it over backward point
length ball, slider at middle stump. Catches him on the pad as he looks to flick and the lbw appeal is turned down. That was going down
short of a length on leg stump, punched past the non-striker, down to long-on
full on middle stump, steps out and mistimes a drive. Straight to extra cover
googly, short of a length and ripping in at middle stump. Chops it to short third off the under edge
tossed up at leg stump, steps out, gets to the pitch and watches it closely as he lifts this over extra cover with the turn
that is plumb. Slider at a length on middle stump. Phillipe loses his shape as he gets on the back foot to try and flick this. Hits him knee height right in front of leg stump
short of a length on leg stump, punched to extra cover off the back foot
short of a length outside off, sliced past point off the back foot
full on middle stump, driven to long-on
short of a length on off stump, punched through cover off the back foot
length ball just outside off, steps out and looks to drive to long-on. Cops it on the thigh guard
length ball in at leg stump, punched to long-on with the angle
googly at a length on middle stump, tapped to midwicket off the back foot
length at middle stump, punched to long-on off the back foot
length at middle stump, steps out and taps it past the non-striker
length on leg stump, punched to long-on off the back foot
outside edge whizzes past slip, to his left. Short and wide slider outside off. Keeps a shade low. He looks to cut and this flies past the fielder
googly at a length outside off. Steps out and drives it back at the bowler, who can't field cleanly to his left
short of a length at middle stump, pulled to deep square off the inside half
short of a length just outside off, defended off the back foot
short and just outside off. Pulled to deep square's right
full and just outside off. Looks to drive, gets an inside edge onto front pad
short ball up at the chest. Shuffles and watches it on as he parries it fine with the pull
length ball down leg side, can't connect on the flick
length outside off, punched on the up to extra cover's right. He parries it to long-off

full on off stump, leading edge to extra cover as he closes the face on this. Lazy attempt to get back in the crease and a run-out call is sent upstairs. He's just made it though. The throw came in on the bounce to the keeper
yorker at leg stump, jammed into the pitch and over the bowler to long-on as he looks to drive
short ball down leg side, looks to pull and gets a top edge over short fine
length at off stump, driven on the up to extra cover's right
yorker outside off, jammed through point
stumping appeal. He was beaten in flight looking to drive a loopy ball outside off. And the back leg was momentarily dragged out...but he managed to get enough of the toe back behind the crease
majestic. Full ball wide outside off. Stays put and slams it inside out over extra cover. The room allowed him that
short of a length ball climbing up as he steps down the pitch and heaves at this. Rises over middle stump
short at middle stump, opens the face and guides to point's left
slower short ball at middle stump, turns it to fine leg with a pull
bouncer at middle stump line, backs away and looks to slice square into the off side. Beaten on the outside edge

dropped. Return catch, tough one. Length ball at leg stump was nailed with a drive on the up and he couldn't reach quickly enough in the follow through. A single at midwicket in the end. Off his knee.
yorker at leg stump, drive to long-on
length ball pushed wide outside off. Throws himself at it and nearly falls over. Thick outside edge falls short of short third man
yorker at middle stump, jammed back to the bowler
length ball sliding across off stump. Slashes and misses
yorker outside off, looks to drive and gets an outside edge that dribbles rapidly past short third man
full on leg stump, flicked to short fine
slower ball, short of a length on leg stump. Flicked to fine leg
slower ball at a length on leg stump, flicked to deep square
full outside off, drilled past the bowler, along the ground to long-on
yorker length wide outside off. Shapes to play the ramp, adjusts and looks for the reverse ramp. Just about gets bat and a single in the end
full at middle stump, slugged down to long-on
low full toss, wide outside off. Chucks the bat at this and slices it over backward point
length ball sliding in at leg stump. Steps out and flicks with soft hands in front of deep midwicket. He runs in and misfields to allow a third
short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper cover
on the roof! Abbott picks the googly, steps out to meet this at a length and pumps it high over long-on! It's out of the stadium after rolling off the roof
full on off stump, driven to extra cover's left
length outside off, steps out and pushes hard at it. Gets a thick inside edge into the open midwicket region
lbw appeal turned down. That looked very close. Length ball at middle and off, turning away a touch. Abbott looked to sweep and was hit in line. Was it spinning past off stump?
slower short ball wide outside off. Slapped on the bounce to extra cover, off the toe-end
clears the midwicket boundary! Back of the hand slower ball goes wrong and Curran waits on this before slapping across the line, on the rise, to clear the boundary
fifty! Tom Curran putting some fear in Thunder now. Low full toss outside off. He looks to chop it square on the off side but gets a thick outside edge that fizzes past short third
low full toss just outside off. Hammered past the bowler, but long-off puts in a slide to his right and stretches to keep this in for long-on
slower short ball outside off. Looks to cut, gets an inside edge down the pitch, back at the bowler
wide of long-off. Dangerous territory for Thunder now. Short ball outside off, plenty of room for Curran to slash at this. And he gets it well in front of square, straight off the middle
yorker at off stump, jammed past the non-striker, down to long-off
length at middle stump, flicked to deep midwicket's left
full and flat at leg stump. Slogs at it and gets a thick inside edge to deep square
yorker length at leg stump, squeezed out to long-on off the inside half
floated up full and wide outside off. Gets to the pitch and drags it out to deep midwicket with the attempted slog

taken by long-off! Crafty from Green. Full and fast at the start of the over and slow and wide when they needed to hit the sixes. Curran looks to slog sweep as this drifts across him, but he can only slice it high for long-off to take to his left. his highest score, and a quality innings, but that should be the end of Sixers' chances
full slower ball, wide outside off. Looks leg side as he heaves, but this is over the bowler and rolling out to long-off off the toe-end
low full toss at leg stump, pings off the inside edge as he looks to slog this. Runs at deep square
taken by long-off. Full slower ball outside off, ends up slicing it as he looks to go straight. Callum Ferguson runs in and takes it with a reverse cup
slower ball at a length outside off, swipes at it and misses
smashes off stump. Yorker at off stump. he backs away and looks to chop it behind point, but that is too good for him
yorker in the corridor, looks to drive and is beaten on the inside edge
